category.motivation: ACEN's wind project is a company news about a new investment, not earnings, so fits company_update

impact.motivation: The article reports a significant renewable energy investment in Tasmania, impacting Australia’s clean energy transition and potentially influencing Australian energy markets and investor sentiment.

time_frame.motivation: The article discusses a long‑term structural investment in renewable capacity that will shape Australia’s energy mix over the coming decade.

article_node.title: ACEN Australia's 900 MW Robbins Island wind project secures federal approval
article_node.summary: ACEN Australia's 900 MW Robbins Island wind project has received federal approval, marking a significant step in Tasmania’s clean energy transition and one of the largest private investments in the state. The AUD 3 billion development will supply power for up to 500,000 homes, create up to 400 construction jobs, and inject more than AUD 30 million annually into the Tasmanian economy, alongside a AUD 27 million community benefits program. The project is expected to begin generating power in 2030, helping Australia meet emissions targets and address looming power shortages as coal exits the system.
